newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Value of new contracts at Israel Aircraft soars.
newsitem.headline: Value of new contracts at Israel Aircraft soars.

text.p: Israel Aircraft Industries (IAI) on Monday said it had signed contracts worth a total of $1.565 billion in the first six months of the year, nearly double the $825 million it had expected.
In the same period last year it signed contracts worth $790 million.
The government-owned company said that by the end of the year it will have received new contracts worth more than $2 billion, marking a record.
The company's sales in the first half of 1997 rose to $750 million from $692 million a year earlier. It expects sales for the entire year to surpass $1.6 billion against $1.49 billion in 1996.
The new contracts boost the company's order backlog to $3.3 billion, guaranteeing continuous work for the next 25 months, even if no new contracts are signed, IAI said.
